repositories.brief_summary: Active development focused on atomic field support and Windows build fixes.
repositories.overall_activity:
- Implementation of **atomic field support** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) with new `%atomic.field` syntax and related type system improvements
- **Windows build fix** reported by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) for `make runtop-with-otherlibs` failing to load otherlibs on Windows platforms ([#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- **Typemod enhancements** with labeled arguments for better code clarity in type module and application functions
- **Unicode identifier support** added to comments by Pieter Goetschalckx
- **Performance optimizations** including faster continuation handling by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo)
repositories.ongoing_summary: Atomic field implementation and Windows platform compatibility improvements in progress.
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Atomic field support development** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) including predef types, typedtree documentation, and test suite creation
- **Windows platform fixes** for otherlibs loading issues in toplevel environment, with potential systhreads integration needed ([#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- **Type system improvements** with enhanced labeled arguments for typemod functions to improve code maintainability
repositories.priority_summary: Windows build compatibility issue requires attention for developer workflow.
repositories.priority_items:
- **Windows toplevel fix** for `make runtop-with-otherlibs` refusing to load otherlibs due to dynamic loading limitations ([#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- Investigation needed for **FlexDLL and linking problems** on Windows platforms affecting development workflow
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on platform compatibility and atomic operations support for modern OCaml development.
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Atomic operations support** with new `%atomic.field` syntax indicating focus on concurrent programming capabilities
- **Cross-platform compatibility** improvements with particular attention to Windows development environment
- **Type system enhancements** for better code clarity and maintainability through labeled function arguments
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from core developers on type system and platform compatibility.
repositories.contributors:
- **[Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)**: Leading atomic field implementation, typemod improvements, and test suite development
- **[Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA)**: Windows platform compatibility issue reporting and investigation ([#13704](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13704))
- **[@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo)**: Performance optimizations in continuation handling
- **Pieter Goetschalckx**: Unicode identifier support in comments
- **[@kit-ty-kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)**: Referenced for cross-repository linking in build system discussions

repositories.brief_summary: Dependency maintenance activities with one new community question about testing practices
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Dependency management** through automated updates by Dependabot for Node.js types and SWC core compiler ([#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434), [#1435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1435), [#1436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1436), [#1432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1432))
- **Nix flake updates** with automated changes to development environment dependencies by GitHub Actions ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437), [#1430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1430))
- **Community inquiry** from [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) about implementing end-to-end testing infrastructure for custom language servers ([#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))
repositories.priority_summary: Community needs guidance on testing practices and private library access
repositories.priority_items:
- **End-to-end testing question** by [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) seeks guidance on implementing e2e testing for custom language servers, highlighting the need for public testing utilities ([#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))
- **Automated dependency updates** require attention as several PRs remain open and could be blocking subsequent updates ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437))
repositories.trends_summary: Regular automated maintenance with focus on keeping development dependencies current
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Automated dependency management** dominance with Dependabot handling Node.js TypeScript definitions and build tools consistently ([#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434), [#1435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1435), [#1436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1436), [#1432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1432))
- **Developer tooling focus** with regular Nix environment updates and build system maintenance ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437), [#1430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1430))
- **Community interest in testing practices** indicating potential need for better documentation or public APIs for language server testing ([#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))
repositories.contributors_summary: Primary contributions from automated systems with one community member engagement
repositories.contributors:
- **Automated maintenance** by Dependabot and GitHub Actions handling regular dependency updates across Node.js and Nix environments ([#1434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1434), [#1435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1435), [#1436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1436), [#1432](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1432), [#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437), [#1430](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1430))
- **Community engagement** from [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) seeking guidance on language server testing practices, representing active developer interest in extending the project's capabilities ([#1438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1438))

repositories.brief_summary: Package management refactoring and Melange improvements landed during the week
repositories.overall_activity:
- Package management **refactoring work** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) focused on simplifying internal types and reducing scope of bindings ([#11270](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11270), [#11269](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11269), [#11267](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11267), [#11262](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11262), [#11261](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11261), [#11259](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11259), [#11258](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11258), [#11257](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11257), [#11256](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11256), [#11250](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11250))
- **Melange improvements** including compile flags fix for js emission by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#11252](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11252)) and manifest information feature by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx)
- New **dune command** for printing paths of ocamllsp and ocamlformat executables by [@sudha](https://github.com/sudha) ([#11243](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11243))
- **Bug fix** for older Git versions with improved error messages ([#11197](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11197))
- Continuous **benchmark tracking** for performance monitoring across all changes
repositories.ongoing_summary: Package management internals receiving systematic refactoring for better maintainability
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Package management refactoring** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) systematically simplifying solver internals, including making functions more private, inlining one-off functions, and improving type safety ([#11270](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11270), [#11269](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11269), [#11267](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11267), [#11262](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11262), [#11259](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11259), [#11258](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11258), [#11257](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11257), [#11256](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11256), [#11250](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11250))
- **Melange development** with active work on manifest generation and compile flag handling by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) and [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) ([#11252](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11252))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on internal code quality improvements and Melange ecosystem development
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Internal refactoring priority** with substantial effort on package management code quality and maintainability improvements by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#11270](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11270), [#11269](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11269), [#11267](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11267), [#11262](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11262), [#11259](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11259), [#11258](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11258), [#11257](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11257), [#11256](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11256), [#11250](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11250))
- **Melange ecosystem investment** with improvements to JS compilation and manifest generation by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) and [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) ([#11252](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11252))
- **Developer experience enhancements** including better tooling integration with new executable path commands ([#11243](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11243))
repositories.contributors_summary: Rudi Grinberg leading extensive package management refactoring with Melange contributors active
repositories.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) led extensive **package management refactoring** work with multiple systematic improvements to solver internals and code organization ([#11270](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11270), [#11269](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11269), [#11267](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11267), [#11262](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11262), [#11261](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11261), [#11259](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11259), [#11258](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11258), [#11257](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11257), [#11256](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11256), [#11250](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11250))
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) improved **Melange JS emission** by fixing compile flags handling ([#11252](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11252))
- [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) contributed **Melange manifest** generation features for better tooling integration
- [@sudha](https://github.com/sudha) added utility command for **executable path discovery** ([#11243](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11243)) and improved **Git error messaging** ([#11197](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11197))
- [@stephen](https://github.com/stephen) added test reproduction case for package management issues ([#11266](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11266))

repositories.brief_summary: Continued discussion on atomic record fields RFC with design considerations for type inference and inline records
repositories.overall_activity: - Ongoing discussion in **atomic record fields RFC** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) with detailed technical analysis of design tradeoffs between offset-only and value-and-offset approaches ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Atomic record fields RFC continues with focus on type inference complexity and inline record compatibility
repositories.ongoing_projects: - **Atomic record fields implementation** with extensive discussion on type-checking complexity, principal mode compatibility, and inline record limitations by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical design discussion on atomic field access patterns and type inference challenges
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Memory model design decisions** around atomic field access syntax with detailed comparison of `[%atomic.field x]` versus `[%atomic.loc r.x]` approaches, including type inference implications and principal mode warnings ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
- **Fine-grained locking use cases** discussion by [@polytypic](https://github.com/polytypic) exploring practical applications for offset-based atomic operations in concurrent data structures ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))
repositories.contributors_summary: Gabriel Scherer led technical discussions on atomic record fields design
repositories.contributors: - [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) continued leading **atomic record fields RFC** with detailed technical analysis of implementation approaches and type system interactions ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/39))

repositories.brief_summary: Platform compatibility issue reported for loong64 architecture bytecode builds
repositories.overall_activity: - **Platform compatibility bug** reported by [wszqkzqk](https://github.com/wszqkzqk) affecting loong64 architecture where `-package` argument is not recognized ([#95](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/95))
repositories.priority_summary: Critical platform compatibility issue blocking package builds on loong64 architecture
repositories.priority_items: - **Loong64 platform compatibility** issue where ocamlc, ocamldoc, and ocamldep fail to recognize `-package` option, blocking builds of multiple OCaml packages including ocaml-astring and ocaml-rresult ([#95](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/95))
repositories.contributors_summary: New issue reporting by Arch Linux Loong64 community leader
repositories.contributors: - [wszqkzqk](https://github.com/wszqkzqk) (Peking University, Arch Linux Loong64 community leader) reported **platform compatibility issue** for loong64 architecture ([#95](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/95))

repositories.brief_summary: Repository maintenance with package archival, OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes, and closure of long-standing checksum issues
repositories.overall_activity:
- Repository **maintenance activities** dominated the week with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) leading package **archival phase 1** for unavailable packages ([#27100](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27100))
- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility** work by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) addressing effect identifier conflicts in riot, miou, and frama-c packages
- **Package lifecycle management** including marking several packages as deprecated (io-page-unix, tar-format, functoria) and resolving **compatibility constraints** for result package
- **New package releases** including ansifmt (0.1.0, 0.1.1, 0.1.3), expect (0.1.0), checked_oint (0.4.1), heroicons-reason-react (1.0), and batteries (3.9.0)
- **Issue resolution** with closure of four long-standing maintenance issues related to broken upstreams and invalid checksums ([#12421](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/12421), [#15298](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/15298), [#19757](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/19757), [#23587](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/23587))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Policy discussion continues on handling non-functional packages in the repository ecosystem
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Repository archival process** being implemented by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) to systematically handle unavailable packages and improve CI efficiency
- **Policy discussion** led by [Etienne Millon](https://github.com/emillon) on managing non-functional packages, exploring solutions for CI optimization while maintaining backward compatibility ([#23697](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/23697))
- **Package maintenance intent updates** by [@lukstafi](https://github.com/lukstafi) for neural network and array computation libraries (arrayjit, neural_nets_lib)
repositories.discussions_summary: Active policy discussion on repository management strategies for maintaining package quality
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Repository governance** discussion in [#23697](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/23697) exploring various approaches to handle non-functional packages without breaking existing installations, with recommendations for CI-aware availability flags
- **Package archival strategy** being developed to balance repository growth with maintainer workload and CI resource consumption
repositories.trends_summary: Focus shifts toward systematic repository maintenance and compatibility with latest OCaml versions
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Systematic package archival** process emerging as key strategy for managing repository scale and CI efficiency
- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility** work becoming routine part of package maintenance, addressing effect system changes
- **Deprecation workflow** being actively used to signal package lifecycle transitions while maintaining backward compatibility
- **Multi-version package management** with careful constraint handling for cross-compatibility issues
repositories.contributors_summary: Repository maintained primarily by core team with focus on systematic cleanup and compatibility work
repositories.contributors:
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) leading **repository archival** efforts and package deprecation workflow
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) handling **OCaml 5.3 compatibility** fixes and package constraint adjustments
- [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) managing **merge activities** and package constraint coordination
- [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) addressing **dependency version** issues in dream package ecosystem
- [@lukstafi](https://github.com/lukstafi) maintaining **machine learning** focused packages and updating maintenance intents

repositories.brief_summary: Continuation performance improvements completed and version management modernization work initiated
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Continuation performance optimization** work concluded with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) closing the original enhancement request ([#1658](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1658)) and [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) closing the related WASM-specific follow-up ([#1779](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1779))
- **Build system modernization** effort started by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) with draft PR to integrate dune-build-info for version management ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1783))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Version management modernization work needs refinement to address build conflicts and version reporting issues
repositories.ongoing_projects: - **Dune-build-info integration** by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) to simplify package version management, currently blocked by build conflicts and incorrect version reporting in mono-repo setups ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1783))
repositories.priority_summary: Draft PR requires conflict resolution and version reporting fixes before merge consideration
repositories.priority_items:
- **Build conflicts resolution** needed for dune-build-info integration PR which currently has mergeable status "CONFLICTING" and affects 22 files ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1783))
- **Version reporting accuracy** issue where expected version prefix should be 5.9.1 but currently shows 5.9.0-617-g3b9f656 ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1783))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on build system modernization and performance optimization for continuation handling
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Build tooling modernization** with adoption of dune-build-info for automated version management across the js_of_ocaml ecosystem ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1783))
- **Continuation performance improvements** completed across both standard and WebAssembly implementations, aligning with upstream OCaml optimizations from [ocaml/ocaml#12735](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12735) ([#1658](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1658), [#1779](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1779))
repositories.contributors_summary: Three contributors active with completion of performance work and initiation of build system improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) completed **continuation performance enhancement** work by closing the foundational issue ([#1658](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1658))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) finalized **WASM-specific continuation optimizations** by resolving the related enhancement request ([#1779](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1779))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) initiated **build system modernization** work with dune-build-info integration draft PR ([#1783](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1783))
